data.text: @globehealthguy @michaelmina_lab @BrighamResearch Yes, thanks, but considering omicron lineage, do you think it recently mutated in a way to become the dominant variant or conditions in the population changed allowing it to become the dominant variant?https://t.co/ns12ddMX4Y https://t.co/YdV3daRbwR

@globehealthguy @michaelmina_lab @BrighamResearch I also mask ,all 3 vaccines Mederna. My worry was day 4 to 6. My husband cough a lot fever 100.3 . I did not cough till 2nd days then bronchitis, pneumonia ? I take  Sterella. for autoimmune . I took antibiotics .  My temp 102 , was Fine on day 4 . I did not treat fever
@andyaschmidt @michaelmina_lab @BrighamResearch Agreed. Hopefully other countries will get ample supply soon, allowing the health system to decompress and be less selective.

@serioustalk01 @michaelmina_lab @BrighamResearch Great to here. In MA we have ample supply of therapeutics but in places like Canada, they unfortunately have to be more selective. Vaccines and testing are the best way through this.

@Dierenbach @michaelmina_lab @BrighamResearch Omicron is the latest strain to widley circulate -severity and symptomatology have decreased but the transmissibility has increased. Large part of having a weakened effect are due to vaccines.

@John17003195 @globehealthguy @michaelmina_lab @BrighamResearch I understood it the first time.  And my points in response stand.

Have a nice day.
@MeNoAreNoNiceG2 @globehealthguy @michaelmina_lab @BrighamResearch Figured maybe you would understand it better
@John17003195 @globehealthguy @michaelmina_lab @BrighamResearch Thank you for the recap of his original tweet.

@MeNoAreNoNiceG2 @globehealthguy @michaelmina_lab @BrighamResearch His dad just tested positive first off so it could still happen (hospital). He is happy there are vaccines available to keep him out of the hospital.
